page.title: 03 ROMAN PALACE
page.content: The palace was built for Cogidubnus in the 1st.Century by the {Romans,}and destroyed by fire 200 years later.It was rediscovered by workmen in 1964. The Roman Palace is a tourist attraction.It is the{largest {Roman villa}to have been discovered north of the Alps. The{museum}has remains from the dig and includes pottery coins,building materials and personal belongings.You can walk around the{mosaics.}Probably the most famous is the Boy and the Dolphin.The gardens have been restored and include the patterns from the Roman times.Flowers and shrubs are similar to the original ones.A farming project has been started with crops being grown,and they keep the breed of sheep and goats that would have been kept at the time the Roman Palace was lived in.
